title: Turkey GREAT start up competition

details.body:
Overview

Entrepreneurs running start up technology companies in Turkey should enter this competition. The aim of the competition is to encourage high growth technology companies in Turkey to look at the UK as a place where they can set up and grow their businesses.

The competition is run by UK Trade & Investment and British Consulate General Istanbul.

A tailored business programme will be organised for the winners in the UK.

Who can enter

The competition is open to individuals who are the main shareholders in the company. The company must be:

  • registered in Turkey
  • established within the last 5 years

Companies can apply in one of the following award categories:

  1. The Female Technology Entrepreneur
  2. The Undergraduate Young Entrepreneur
  3. The Technology Entrepreneur from Anatolia
  4. The Social Technology Entrepreneur
  5. The Jury’s Special Award

Prizes

One winner will be announced from each category. The winners will receive:

  • one round-trip plane ticket from Istanbul to London
  • three nights accommodation in London
  • consultancy services by accountants and lawyers on setting up in the UK, work visas and tax
  • mentoring sessions by arranged through the Global Entrepreneurship Programme
  • guided tour of London technology hub ‘Tech City’
  • briefing on opportunities in the UK and tech clusters by London and Partners
  • networking opportunities with venture capitals in the UK

Judging criteria

Applicants will be judged on the following criteria (% in bracket indicates portion of overall scores).

  • innovative, practical and profitable business idea (25%)
  • quality of information supporting the business idea - e.g. in-depth analysis and research on the market (25%)
  • actual or projected returns and potential for growth (20%)
  • how closely their product or service relates to the award category entered (10%)
  • potential for the business to succeed in the UK (20%)

Applying

Apply by completing the online application form before 30 September 2014.

Timings

The deadline for applications is 30 September 2014.

The judging panel will meet between 1 October - 8 October and shortlist 3 companies from each category.

One winner will be announced from each category at the British Technology Summit on 20 October 2014

Selection panel

Winners will be selected by a panel of judges. They are:

  • Leigh Turner, HM Consul General and Director- General of UKTI Turkey, Central Asia & South Caucasus
  • Daniel King, Head of High Growth & Emerging Markets of UKTI Inward Investment Global Operations
  • James Tyler, Chief Commercial Officer TelecityGroup International Limited
  • Ali Sabancı, CEO, Pegasus Airlines
  • Nevzat Aydın, CEO, Yemek Sepeti.com
  • Canan Özsoy, CEO, GE Turkey
  • Sina Afra, Founder of Markafoni.com
  • Ümit Boyner, Executive Board Member, Boyner Holding
  • M. Rauf Ateş/ Editor in Chief Capital, Ekonomist, Startup Business Magazines
  • Fatih İşbecer, CEO Monitise Turkey
  • İhsan Elgin, Girişim Fabrikası
  • Tuğrul Tekbulut, Logo Yazılım
  • Hasan Aslanoba/, Angel Investor

Sponsors

  • Telecity
  • Monitise

Contact

If you have any questions about the competition please contact Begüm Özcan begum@bizzconsulting.com.tr Tel: 0212 347 45 24.

Find out how UKTI services can help your company expand to the UK by contacting Ecem Toprakseven ecem.toprakseven@fco.gov.uk, or Mehmet Basaran mehmet. basaran@fco.gov.uk.
